This mirrors the pattern of the ConnectionFactory interface
:memo: Wrap docs at 80 characters

Inline max connections value
Replace tabs with spaces
Added maxConnections property.

Make HttpRequestException constructor public

This allows sub-classes easily throw it when overriding methods
in HttpRequest.

Refs #52
Bump README version to 5.4.1
[maven-release-plugin] prepare for next development iteration
[maven-release-plugin] prepare release http-request-5.4.1

Return empty stream when input and error streams are unavailable

Previously if stream() was called for an error response that had
an empty body an exception would be thrown.

Now an empty stream will be returned so the body can be successfully
read as an empty stream.
Add @oskarhagberg to contributors

Fix HttpRequest.followRedirects use of static setter

Should alter the instance and not use the static default setter.
Drop unneeded curlies from connection factory example
Add missing 'a' in authentication
Add link to @jakewharton OkHttp Gist
Update index.html from page generator

[maven-release-plugin] prepare for next development iteration
[maven-release-plugin] prepare release http-request-5.4
Add connection factory example
Remove extra newline
Add @JakeWharton to contributors
Restore default factory when param is null

Add ConnectionFactory abstraction for creating new HTTP connections.

This allows us to plug other `HttpUrlConnection`-compatible implementations
into the helpers.

Closes #39
Tweak exception message text
Add space after comma
Stop proxy during tear down
:lipstick:

Closes #19

[maven-release-plugin] prepare for next development iteration

Widen append varargs to be Object instead of String
Make content type and encoding constants public
Add CRLF constant
Add Travis CI status to README
Add initial Travis CI configuration
Add @michael-wang to contributors
Rename type parameter to contentType
Overload part() to take String part with content type
DRY up sending Content-Disposition
Add missing Javadoc tags and comments
Use two-space indent

Allow user to send content type as multipart header.

Closes #13
Add query param example
Bump version in README to 3.1
[maven-release-plugin] prepare for next development iteration
[maven-release-plugin] prepare release http-request-3.1
Add unit tests of setting Content-Type request header

Support posting form without charset parameter

Specifying a null or empty charset will not add the
charset to the Content-Type header of the request but
will encoding the parameters using UTF-8
Treat empty and null charsets the same way
Add link to Used By wiki page to README
Correct typo in nonProxyHosts() comment
Correct typo in dateHeader comment
Correct typo in contentLength() comment
DRY up setProperty
Don't create needless empty array when hosts are null
Add assert for setting null Number header
Add unit test of sending empty headers map

Add isBodyEmpty() helper

Checks if the Content-Length response header is 0

Reuse HTTP server across all tests

Replace the active handler instead of creating and
destroying a new server on each test.

This reduces the time taken to run the tests from
10 to 0.5 seconds.
Upgrade to junit 4.10
Upgrade version to 3.0
[maven-release-plugin] prepare for next development iteration
[maven-release-plugin] prepare release http-request-3.0
DRY up closing output stream and re-throwing any IO exceptions
Close request output stream before reading int response header
Close request output stream before reading date response header
Close request output stream before reading response headers

Close request output stream before reading response header

Closes issue #10
Only iterate over headers if map is non-empty

Remove unneeded uri variable

Just return the value of new URI().toAsciiString()
instead
Add test of no server compression when requested
Add more tests of code helpers
Add test of post with escaped varargs query params
Remove numbers in test case names
Add tests of varargs query param request helpers
DRY up how missing path separator is added

Widen query param request helpers to take a CharSequence

Allows them to be called with an already built up
CharSequence sub-class such as StringBuilder.

Guard against base URL already containing '?' and '&'

This allows the base URL to already contain query parameters
and the append methods to properly append additional ones
without adding extra '?' and '&' characters that aren't
needed.
Use consistent ordering of request helpers
Add unit tests of head requests with query params
Remove unneeded HttpRequest qualifier
Add query param helpers for HEAD requests
Add request helpers that take a varargs of query params
Add test of odd number of param arguments
Remove unneeded variables
Add version of append that takes a varargs of query params
[maven-release-plugin] prepare for next development iteration
[maven-release-plugin] prepare release http-request-2.2
Update generated index page for latest README
Upgrade README version to 2.2
Add test of reused SSL socket factory
Add test of reused hostname verifier
Add test of trusted hostname verifier
Upgrade version to 2.2
Mark parameters as final
Mention full url will be encoded, not just params
Use ? operator for encoding check

Widen query parameter map to support keys of any type

toString() will be invoked on all keys allowing non-String
query parameter name keys to be used.

Reuse hostname verifier and ssl socket factory

Previously a new instance would be created on each
call to trustAllCerts() and trustAllHosts() but the
implementation always did the same thing in all
cases so now a single instance is reused across
all requests and stored in new static fields.
Use single return in trustAllHosts()
Add newline after early return
Detab and replace with two space indention
Mention the toString value being used for parameter values
Add test of appending params with null values
Add more units tests of HttpRequest.append
Add tests for escaped query parameters
Verify params retrieved from server request
Add Levi Notik to contributors list

Only append trailing slash when needed

A trailing slash is only needed when the base URL
has no path segments

Move optional encoding to static request helpers

This allows append to only be concerned with joining
a base URL with a map of query parameters.
Unroll loop to avoid length checking on each pass
Support maps with any value type
Return base URL when params are null or empty
Make query param helper public

Add query param helpers

Closes issue #5
Add example of ignoring security
Use new headers() method internally
Expand return parameter documentation in headers()
Add Sean Jensen-Grey to contributors

Add helper to return all headers

Closes issue #6
Add missing throws declaration on form method
Add missing throws declaration on writer method
Add missing throws declaration on receive method
Expand comments on proxy helpers
Replace 'a' with 'an' on options method comment

Remove comment on private serialization constant

This comment previously just repeated the variable name
Use char separator instead of String
Document default buffer size
Upgrade release version to 2.1
Add unit test of receiving the response to a PrintStream
Add unit test of Content-Type header helper
Add missing override annotations
[maven-release-plugin] prepare for next development iteration
[maven-release-plugin] prepare release http-request-2.1
Widen send call to take a CharSequence
DRY up how fallback charset is ensured
Remove unused import
Add newlines around super calls
Add support for getting a writer to the request body
Add missing override annotations
Add generated slate theme to gh-pages site
Update version to 2.0
[maven-release-plugin] prepare for next development iteration
[maven-release-plugin] prepare release http-request-2.0

Don't create intermediate maps when sending single form entry

Previously all form posting was done via the Map parameter
version which created an intermediate singleton map for
each other call to form taking either an entry or a name/value
combination.

This was unnecessary and now the main form sending method
is the name/value pair version which all overloaded versions
forward to.
Add unit test of posting form entry with null value

Match string exactly when verifying form data

A LinkedHashMap is used so order is consistent and can
be verified by an exact string match.
Add helper for sending form data using Entry objects
Add helpers to getting date/int headers with default value

Correct typo in entity tag example

Should use receive instead of body.

Closes issue #3
Add helper to get all parameters in a response header
Add helper to get parameter values from response headers
Rename incorrectly named local variable
Add helper to get all values of header from response

Add helper to take map of headers to set

This removes the varargs version which required an even
number of elements.  This was a poor decision initially
since the header method taken two String paremeters was
fluid and just as convenient for multiple calls
Add gzip example and upgrade version to 1.1
[maven-release-plugin] prepare for next development iteration
[maven-release-plugin] prepare release http-request-1.1
Upgrade to GitHub site plugin 0.6

Remove unused downloads plugin

Built JARs are now available from Maven Central
Add unit test of posting an empty form data map

Add GZIP support options

Adds two new methods, acceptGzipEncoding() and uncompress()
which allow automatic uncompressing of responses using an
underlying GzipInputStream when the server responds with a
gzip response body.

This now allows all calls that read from the response to
support reading the data uncompressed so no further conversion
is needed.
Add unit test that posts multiple files to URL
Consistently use static imports in HttpRequestTest
Add helper to encode URL CharSequence
Remove .nojekyll and use configuration of Maven site plugin
Remove unneeded throws and document empty blocks are intentional

Include GeneralSecurityException cause from trustAllCerts()

Previously only the message was retained, now the entire
cause exception is set on the IOException thrown as part of
a HttpRequestException
Specify version of gpg plugin to use
Bump version in README to 1.0
[maven-release-plugin] prepare for next development iteration
[maven-release-plugin] prepare release http-request-1.0
Bump POM file version to 1.0-SNAPSHOT

Call bufferedReader() from receive()

Removes duplication of creating a new BufferedReader
Mark first method variable as final

Put toString call in try block that catches IOException

This combines both calls in HttpRequest.body(String) to
be done in the same try block that catches the common
super exception type of IOException.
Mark method parameters as final
Add unit test for HttpRequest.acceptJson()
Add helper to set Accept header to application/json
Bump README version to 0.9.1
[maven-release-plugin] prepare for next development iteration
[maven-release-plugin] prepare release http-request-0.9.1

Use UTF-8 as character set when none is specified

Previously the platform's default character set was used
which may lead to inconsistent behavior when running on different
platforms.  UTF-8 seems like a reasonable default to consistently
use and can still be overridden when necessary.
Bump README version to 0.9
[maven-release-plugin] prepare for next development iteration
[maven-release-plugin] prepare release http-request-0.9
Add unit test for getting buffered reader of response body
DRY up call to bufferedReader with no character set specified
Correct typos in Javadoc comments
Add helper to get buffered reader to response body
Add more documentation to HTTPS helpers
Correct typo in trustAllHosts Javadoc
Bump README version to 0.8
[maven-release-plugin] prepare for next development iteration
[maven-release-plugin] prepare release http-request-0.8

Support calling form() multiple times per request

Add a leading '&' when form() is called after the initial time
Bump README version to 0.7
[maven-release-plugin] prepare for next development iteration
[maven-release-plugin] prepare release http-request-0.7

Remove explicit flush() of request output stream

Instead rely on close() calls calling flush() as documented
Bump README version to 0.6
[maven-release-plugin] prepare for next development iteration
[maven-release-plugin] prepare release http-request-0.6

Overload receive() to take a PrintStream parameter

This allows receive() to be called with System.out without
a downcast to either Appendable or OutputStream
Bump version in README to 0.5
[maven-release-plugin] prepare for next development iteration
[maven-release-plugin] prepare release http-request-0.5

Widen argument type to CharSequence from String

This allows requests to be created directly from StringBuilder
or other CharSequence implementors
Add more unit tests of HttpRequest
Add getters for buffer size and ignoring close exceptions
Document where UTF-8 is used by default
Document where and how bufferSize setting is used
Document that streams/readers will be closed in send()
Add .nojekyll file to site resources

Ignore close exceptions by default

Add setting to re-enable if they should bubble up

Don't ignore flush exceptions on close

Call flush explicitly on output stream allowing exceptions
to be reported since they are ignored when FilterOutputStream.close
is called
Add link to Javadocs
Remove misplaced backticks
Move Usage section to top, bump version, and link to downloads
Bump GitHub plugin version to 0.4
[maven-release-plugin] prepare for next development iteration

Add downloads and site plugins to build
Use characters instead of strings when length is 1
Add helper for URLConnection.setUseCaches
[maven-release-plugin] prepare for next development iteration

Clear http.nonProxyHosts value when set to null or empty array

Add more unit tests of error streams
Add helper classes to ensure closing and flushing occurs
Add more unit tests of HttpRequest class
User configured buffer size for internal readers
Throw original exception when close() exception occurs
Use configured buffer size when receiving response as file
Remove unneeded local variable
Add helpers to set http/https proxy properties
Add more unit tests of HttpRequest class
Remove duplication when sending a part with a number value
[maven-release-plugin] prepare for next development iteration
[maven-release-plugin] prepare release http-request-0.1
Add target directory to .gitignore
Add send/receive support for reader/writer
Correct typo in connectTimeout Javadoc
Use partHeader to set Content-Disposition value

Add initial unit test of multipart requests.

Also rename test class to match class being tested
Use readable content boundary
Add space before filename parameter
Update checked header in basic authentication test
Override getCause to return casted IOException
Update exception reference in unit test
Rename RequestException to HttpRequestException
Only use content length to size stream if positive value
Add description, inception year, and issue management sections
Remove extra newlines in SCM URLs
Correct number in notModified() @return Javadoc
Write form data in UTF-8 by default

Require IOException cause when creating a RequestException
Add documentation about instance reuse

Return error stream immediately if available
Use static imports for code constants from HttpURLConnection

Unify error and input streams.

This removes errorStream() and errorBody() since they are now
returned by the stream() and body() methods by checking the
response code.
Add more request header helper unit tests

Remove helper for 'Host' request header.

This cannot be overridden using HttpUrlConnection.
Rename errorString() to errorBody() for consistency
Add unit tests for header helpers
Add helper to set 'If-Modified-Since' request header
Add helper to set connect timeout
Update exception messages used in headers()

Overload header to take a Number value
Consistently use 'send' for methods that write to request body
